newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Sun Fook Kong surges on takeover hopes.
newsitem.headline: Sun Fook Kong surges on takeover hopes.

text.p: Sun Fook Kong Holdings Ltd shares soared on Tuesday after it said it was in talks with China Travel International Investment Hong Kong Ltd that could lead to China Travel taking a stake in the company.
Sun Fook Kong shares surged to HK$2.10 in early trade before falling back to HK$1.99, up HK$0.49. Volume was 106.4 million shares worth HK$215.5 million.
"The rally is fuelled by the possible takeover news," said Michael Ng, dealing director at Sassoon Securities.
But he said the stock looked quite dangerous to chase at current levels.
Sun Fook Kong said the negotiations may or may not result in an actual deal.
China Travel International is a listed investment arm of mainland tourism conglomerate China Travel Service group.

Analysts said investors bought shares of Sun Fook Kong, a construction and civil engineering group, on hopes that China Travel's mainland parent would inject quality assets into the company to help it grow once a takeover materialised.
China Travel shares were up HK$0.05 to HK$4.05.
